Detailed Description

Abtract Resource Manager interface. It defines the minimal functionality that should be implemented by a resource manager. A resource manager is a generic object that handles interactions between tasks and Resources.

AbsTask and Resource.

Definition at line 37 of file absresmanager.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void addResource ( char *  name = "",
int  n = 1,
void *  p = NULL 
)
virtual

Adds the resource to the set of resources managed by the Resource Manager. Should check if the resource is already present in such set

virtual void release ( AbsTask *  t,
char *  name,
int  n = 1 
)
virtual

Function called by a task instr to perform the release of a specific resource. The consequence of this call could be the reactivation of one or more suspended tasks. Should check if the resource is among the ones handled by this manager

virtual bool request ( AbsTask *  t,
char *  name,
int  n = 1 
)
virtual

Function called by a task instr to perform an access request to a specific resource. That access could be granted or the task could be suspended. Should check if the resource is among the ones handled by this manager
